These names are all empty, deceptive, and unreal;
It is as explained in the section on breaking down form and names.

The celestial beings had this thought:

Subhuti knew that the minds of the heavenly beings were confused and submerged in the profound prajna, unable to extricate themselves, and therefore said:
Prajnaparamita is no different from the five aggregates. The true nature of the five aggregates is prajnaparamita.
Now, the five aggregates are neither profound nor wonderful, up to and including omniscience, which is neither profound nor wonderful.
At that time, the heavenly beings deeply understood that although Subhuti spoke of form with his mouth, his mind had nothing to say, and the same was true up to anuttara-samyak-sambodhi.
Subhuti knew the minds of the heavenly beings and replied:
It is so!
It is like this!
It is not only I alone who am like this!
When the Buddha attained enlightenment, there was also no speaking. The characteristic of quiescent extinction is truly without speaker or listener.
Therefore, from the fruit of stream-entry up to Buddhahood, all are due to the unconditioned dharmas.
Apart from these dharmas and apart from these forbearances, there is no stream-enterer, and so forth up to Buddhahood is also like this.
From the initial generation of the mind of the bodhisattva up to attaining Buddhahood, in between, all dharmas are without speaking and without hearing.

Because they cannot be known, one has no grasping and no attachment to all dharmas and then enters nirvana.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
